comments:
(reported by Woody Huang)

I am working on migrating dynamic UI to the latest Equinox/Eclipse but I
encountered a problem. I can't restart a bundle that has been uninstalled. (...)

The exception I got reads:

org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The bundle could not be resolved. Reason:
probably another version has been chosen 
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:437)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Bundle.start(Bundle.java:329)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandProvider._start(FrameworkCommandProvider.java:243)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandInterpreter.execute(FrameworkCommandInterpreter.java:152)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.docommand(FrameworkConsole.java:317)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:298)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:257)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.run(FrameworkConsole.java:232)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

traces.message: The bundle could not be resolved. Reason: probably another version has been chosen
